title: Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer
description:
Chief Financial \& Operating Officer (CFO/COO)

**Location:** Dallas, TX (Hybrid Position)  
**Reports to:** Founder / Principal  
**Type:** Full\-time preferred; part\-time considered for the right candidate

About Gas Lamp Design

Gas Lamp Design is a growing interior design studio specializing in multifamily and boutique hospitality projects. We are design\-driven, detail\-oriented, and deeply invested in building a sustainable, scalable business that supports creative excellence. We are seeking a CFO/COO to serve as a long\-term strategic partner to leadership and help guide the firm through its next phase of growth.

Role Overview

The CFO/COO is a senior leadership role responsible for the financial health, operational efficiency, and long\-term strategic planning of the firm. This individual will be deeply embedded in the business and actively involved in day\-to\-day operations as well as high\-level strategy.

**This is not a fractional or advisory\-only role.** While we are open to a **part\-time arrangement for the right candidate**, we are seeking someone who is committed to the firm, understands our business intimately, and can grow with us over time.

Key Responsibilities: **Financial Leadership \& Strategy**

* Serve as a strategic advisor to the Founder/Principal on financial and operational decisions
* Develop and oversee firm\-wide financial strategy, including long\-term projections, cash flow planning, and growth scenarios
* Create and manage annual budgets, forecasts, and financial models
* Monitor firm profitability by project, client, and service type (design fees, procurement, etc.)
* Provide regular financial reporting and insights to leadership (monthly, quarterly, annual)

Accounting \& Compliance

* Oversee day\-to\-day accounting operations and manage the in\-house bookkeeper
* Ensure accurate and timely monthly close and financial statements
* Manage all tax planning, filings, and deadlines (federal, state, payroll, sales/use tax, etc.)
* Coordinate with external CPAs, tax advisors, and auditors as needed
* Maintain strong internal controls and compliance practices

Procurement \& Project Financials

* Oversee financial systems related to FF\&E procurement, including cash flow timing, vendor payments, and client billing
* Ensure proper tracking and reconciliation of procurement revenue, cost of goods, and margins
* Support project teams with fee structures, billing schedules, and financial performance tracking
* Improve systems for managing retainers, reimbursables, and phased billing

Operations \& Process Improvement

* Lead process improvement initiatives to increase efficiency across finance, operations, and project workflows
* Evaluate and optimize financial, project management, and procurement systems/tools
* Establish scalable processes that support growth while maintaining flexibility
* Partner with leadership to align operations with firm culture and design priorities

Business Growth \& Leadership

* Support strategic growth initiatives, including hiring, new service offerings, and geographic expansion
* Develop KPIs and dashboards to track firm performance
* Help shape firm policies related to contracts, pricing, risk management, and operations
* Act as a steady, trusted leader who brings clarity, accountability, and momentum

Qualifications

* CPA required
* 10\+ years of progressive financial and operational leadership experience
* Proven experience helping grow and scale a small business
* Prior experience in an architecture, interior design, or professional services firm strongly preferred
* Deep understanding of project\-based accounting and procurement workflows
* Strong financial modeling, budgeting, and forecasting skills
* Experience managing staff and external consultants
* Proactive, solutions\-oriented mindset with a high level of ownership
* Excellent communication skills and ability to partner with creative leadership

Why Join Gas Lamp Design

* Key leadership role with real influence over the firm’s future
* Close partnership with founder and leadership team
* Opportunity to build and refine systems, processes, and strategy
* Creative, collaborative environment with a strong design ethos
* Competitive compensation and benefits commensurate with experience

title: Fractional CFO
description:

Let’s be clear from the start.

This is not a traditional CFO role.

**BostonSpeaks** is looking for a **modern, heart\-centered Fractional CFO** who enjoys being part of a team and wants to grow *with* the company

At BostonSpeaks, we help leaders overcome public speaking anxiety, and we bring that same depth, honesty, and humanity into how we work together.

**We’re looking for someone who:**

* Values human connection as much as performance
* Resonates with a culture of openness, self\-awareness, and growth
* Believes numbers should create clarity, confidence, and freedom — not fear

**About the Role**

You’ll act as a strategic financial partner to our leadership team as BostonSpeaks continues to grow. Your role is to bring clarity, structure, and stability in a way that feels supportive, human, and empowering.

**You’ll enjoy this role if you:**

* Love translating numbers into **plain\-English decisions**
* Are energized by **small, purpose\-driven teams**
* Use modern tools and systems and have opinions about them
* Are comfortable challenging leadership with clarity and kindness
* Enjoy teaching leaders how to think financially, not just reporting numbers
* Want to lead and shape the finance function as the company evolves

**What You’ll Focus On**

* Cash flow, forecasting, and financial visibility
* Budgets aligned with company goals
* Scalable systems and automations (QuickBooks, Wise, Monday)
* Clear, simple financial processes that support sustainable growth

**Culture \& Fit**

Culture is not a side note at BostonSpeaks, it’s the foundation.

You’ll feel at home here if you:

* Believe growth starts from within and are willing to question your own assumptions
* Value authentic communication and real conversations
* Care deeply about the quality of the work *and* how it feels to do it
* Believe finance can be both **structured and heart\-centered**

How to Apply

If this resonates, we’d love to get to know you.  
Email **sophie@bostonspeaks.com** with:

A loom/sendspark/… video introducing yourself, telling us

* Why are you interested in working with BostonSpeaks?
* Your experience in finance and leadership roles
* Why do you think you would be a good cultural fit for our company?
* What are your expectation

Assume BostonSpeaks currently generates $1\.4M annual revenue with $280,000 profit. Our 1\-year goal is to reach $2\.1M annual revenue with a 30% profit margin. With only this information:

* What would be the first questions you would ask to understand our business financially?
* What areas would you focus on first in this role? (Top 3 priorities)
* (High\-level is fine; we’re evaluating your thinking, not precision.)

What Happens Next?

Once we review your message, we’ll reach out if we believe you’re a great fit for the role.Our process typically includes a short discovery call followed by a second interview with Hayleigh and Kit, our COO and CEO.

\-Team BostonSpeaks

title: Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Culture Officer
description:
**Job Summary**

**Quentasia Studios**

Quentasia Studios is building a new model for premium, inclusive storytelling—one designed to be legible, auditable, and investable at institutional scale. As we prepare to scale into a multi\-slate entertainment studio, we are seeking a **Chief Financial Officer (CFO)** who is not only a rigorous financial operator, but a strategic partner capable of translating creative ambition into durable economic outcomes.

This role is for someone who understands that **financial discipline is not a constraint on creativity — it is the condition that makes creative freedom possible**.

Why This Role Matters

The CFO will be one of the most critical architects of Quentasia’s future.

This role will directly influence:

* How capital is raised, structured, and protected
* How investors experience transparency and trust
* How creative projects are financed without compromising values
* How Quentasia earns credibility with institutional allocators

This is an opportunity to help build a studio that treats finance not as a back\-office function, but as a core strategic capability.

Key ResponsibilitiesCapital Strategy \& Investor Stewardship

* Co\-lead capital raising across equity, debt, and strategic partnerships.
* Represent Quentasia in conversations with family offices, institutions, banks, and strategic capital partners.
* Design capital structures that balance risk, flexibility, and long\-term value creation.
* Partner with the CEO in articulating Quentasia’s financial narrative to investors and stakeholders.

Financial Strategy, Modeling \& Governance

* Design and maintain financial models for the studio and slate, including project cash flows, recoupment waterfalls, and return scenarios.
* Establish clear financial guardrails that enable growth while protecting downside risk.
* Build systems that allow investors to understand performance, not just projections.

Systems, Controls \& Transparency

* Build and oversee robust financial systems, controls, and reporting frameworks.
* Ensure compliance with accounting standards, internal controls, and risk management protocols.
* Partner with internal and external stakeholders to ensure financial data is accurate, timely, and decision\-useful.

Production Finance \& Structural Oversight

* Oversee project\-level financing structures, including SPVs, tax incentives, payroll, and union/guild compliance.
* Ensure production finance decisions align with both investor expectations and creative realities.
* Coordinate with production accounting teams to ensure consistency and discipline across projects.

Strategic Partnership with the CEO

* Serve as the CEO’s closest partner in evaluating trade\-offs between growth, capital deployment, and long\-term sustainability.
* Provide clear, principled counsel in moments of ambiguity or pressure.
* Help shape the long\-term operating model of the studio as it scales.

Culture, Integrity \& Financial Leadership

* Uphold Quentasia’s values in all financial dealings.
* Model integrity, clarity, and accountability in decision\-making.
* Lead with both rigor and humanity, recognizing that finance is ultimately about stewarding trust.

Ideal Candidate Profile

* Senior finance leader with experience in entertainment, media, private equity, or complex operating environments.
* Demonstrated track record in capital raising and structuring sophisticated financial transactions.
* Deep experience building financial systems, controls, and reporting infrastructure.
* Strong understanding of US GAAP, IFRS, production finance, tax incentives, and unionized workforces is highly valued.
* Comfortable operating in a lean, evolving organization while building for scale.
* High emotional intelligence, strong communication skills, and investor presence.
* A principled operator who believes finance exists to enable excellence, not restrict it.

Engagement Structure

Because Quentasia is in a pre\-funding and early scaling phase, this role will begin as:

* Advisory or fractional, transitioning to full\-time as financing milestones are achieved
* Active participation in capital strategy and leadership formation
* Advisory equity participation to reflect early belief and contribution
* Full compensation package (salary \+ equity) activated post\-funding

Candidates must be willing to sign a non\-binding **Letter of Intent (LOI)** confirming interest in being identified as part of Quentasia’s founding leadership circle.

The Opportunity

Most studios hire CFOs to manage budgets.

At Quentasia, you will help design the financial system that makes ambitious, values\-aligned storytelling sustainable at scale.

You will help build a studio where capital is disciplined, transparency is non\-negotiable, and financial leadership is a source of strength — for creators, investors, and the company alike.

* Are you willing to begin this role in an advisory capacity, with compensation in the form of equity until funding is secured?
* Are you comfortable participating in early leadership discussions and senior\-team selection prior to full funding?
* Are you willing to sign a non\-binding Letter of Intent (LOI) confirming interest in a future leadership role and allowing us to present your name and resume to investors?
* Do you understand that this opportunity is pre\-funding and does not include salary or benefits at the initial advisory stage?

Galt Pharmaceuticals is a purpose\-driven organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients by providing products that address unmet clinical needs. We empower entrepreneurs, support our employees, and make a positive impact in the communities we serve. We are seeking a highly motivated, self\-starting Director of Compliance to join our growing team!

 ***This is a part\-time (18\-20 hrs. per week) position. We provide a flexible and collaborative work environment with hybrid, coworking, and flex office space options! Our office is conveniently located in the Atlanta Metro area!***

 **Position Overview:**



Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer \& Co\-Founder, as the Director of Compliance, you will design, implement, and oversee Galt's ethics and compliance program, ensuring adherence to a dynamic landscape of federal, state, and international laws and regulations. This leadership role is critical to mitigating legal and financial risks, preventing misconduct, and promoting a strong culture of ethical conduct across the organization. In\-depth knowledge of FDA, OIG, EMA, DOJ, Medicare/Medicaid regulations and a strong understanding of healthcare laws such as the Anti\-Kickback Statute, False Claims Act, PDMA, GMP, GCP, and Sunshine Act is required. Candidates with contract management experience are encouraged to apply.

 **Responsibilities:**


* **Program Management:** Develop, execute, and continuously improve the corporate compliance program across all business units.
* **Risk Assessment \& Mitigation:** Identify compliance risks and vulnerabilities; conduct audits and reviews; develop corrective action plans; implement preventative strategies.
* **Regulatory Monitoring:** Stay abreast of evolving laws, regulations, and industry trends from regulatory bodies (FDA, EMA, DOJ, OIG, etc.) and industry codes (e.g., PhRMA Code). Ensure manufacturing and vendor relationships are compliant.
* **Policy Development:** Draft, update, and maintain compliance policies, SOPs, and the corporate code of conduct.
* **Training \& Communication:** Lead the development and delivery of compliance training for employees and third parties; foster a culture of compliance through clear, effective communication.
* **Internal Investigations:** Oversee or assist in investigations of potential compliance violations; document findings and ensure appropriate corrective action.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** Serves as a liaison between outside counsel and/or consulting services; serves as a strategic partner and compliance advisor to senior management, legal counsel, medical and regulatory affairs, and cross\-functional teams; represent Galt during regulatory inspections and client audits.
* **Reporting:** Prepare and present reports on compliance activities, program effectiveness, and risk metrics to senior leadership and compliance committees.
* **Compliance and Administration:** Ensure contracts, programs, business initiatives comply with corporate policies, legal requirements, and industry regulations, and maintain organized records.
* Performs other duties, as assigned.

  


**Professional Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (science, law, business administration, or related discipline). Master's or JD preferred.
* Minimum 5 years experience in the pharmaceutical, healthcare, or biotech industry, with at least 3–5 years in a compliance leadership or managerial role.
* Pharmaceutical Compliance Certification (Certified Pharmaceutical Industry Professional (CPIP), Certified in Healthcare Compliance (CHC), or Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) Certified Professional, etc.) is preferred.
* Experience with federal reimbursement, discounts, rebates, and pricing is a plus.
* Proven leadership skills and experience managing teams and cross\-functional projects.
* Self\-starter with the ability to work independently and proactively with minimal supervision.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills; demonstrated ability to translate complex regulations into clear policies and effective training.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving abilities, particularly in risk assessment and solution development.
* High ethical standards and integrity, with the ability to build trust and credibility across all stakeholders.

  


**Employment Requirements:**


* Must pass a background check.
* Must be legally authorized to work in the United States.

title: Fractional Customer Success Manager
description:
**About Malloy Industries**

helps growth\-stage CEOs scale from $1M\-$50M in annual revenue by connecting them with relentlessly generous fractional executives who deliver strategic leadership without the full\-time price tag. Over the past five years, we’ve served 125\+ companies through our network of 400\+ fractional executives, maintaining an 80%\+ customer retention rate and a 95%\+ placement success rate.

We’re a delightfully tiny, fully remote team that operates on five core values: relentlessly generous, vulnerably trustworthy, enthusiastically fun, independently productive, and flexibly learning. We expect our team to go the extra mile for clients and each other, bring their whole selves to work (Brené Brown style), infuse every meeting with laughter and dad jokes, work autonomously without micromanagement, and Google their way to victory when facing new challenges.

**Customer Success Manager Job Description**

We’re seeking a fractional Customer Success Manager who thrives at the intersection of client success, project management, and strategic growth. This is not a traditional customer success role—you’ll be the trusted advisor to both our fractional executives and the CEOs who hire them, ensuring exceptional service delivery while identifying opportunities to expand relationships. You’ll manage a book of 5\-15 clients and coordinate 5\-25 active fractional executives, serving as the connective tissue that makes our marketplace hum.

In a typical week, you’ll conduct 1\-5 client check\-ins, guide new clients through our Strategic Clarity \& Matchmaking Program™, monitor fractional executive performance, and strategically identify upsell opportunities within our portfolio. You’ll spend roughly 50% of your time on client success, 30% on delivery coordination during Month 1 engagements, and 20% on expanding existing relationships with additional fractional roles or extended engagements.

You have strong relationship management skills. You possess excellent communication skills, fluency in English, proven client\-facing experience, and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision while managing multiple client relationships simultaneously. You know how to clearly communicate internally on Slack.

This role reports to our Chief of Staff, Tina Moriarty, and offers a clear path to Customer Success Director as we scale. You’ll receive abundant learning opportunities, continuing education support, and professional development resources to grow alongside our business.

**What You’ll Do**

**Client Relationship Management**

* Conduct 1\-5 weekly check\-ins with fractional executives and client companies to ensure service quality, alignment, and satisfaction
* Serve as the primary point of contact for ongoing client communications, acting as a trusted advisor to C\-level executives
* Monitor fractional executive performance against Malloy Industries standards and client expectations
* Run professional client meetings with confidence, clarity, and strategic insight

**Strategic Clarity \& Matchmaking Program™ Delivery**

* Guide new clients through our Month 1 onboarding process, ensuring seamless transitions and early wins
* Conduct a full Scalable Operational Maturity Assessment™ across finance, operations, HR, marketing, sales, and leadership functions
* Complete additional assessments, which may require you to ask scripted questions on Zoom, share your screen, and take notes based on responses
* Write, review, and/or deliver weekly Trust\-building Progress Snapshot (TPS) Reports™ to ensure transparent communication and alignment on all project activities
* Identify bottlenecks preventing the Client from scaling to include in the Fractional Executive Scope of Work (SOW) documents
* Collaborate on a Prioritized Action Plan
* Use our proprietary AI matchmaking algorithm to identify top candidates
* Screen, vet, and/or interview the best Fractional Executive candidates to present the top 1\-3 candidates with video responses and profiles to the Client
* Facilitate Client and candidate interviews and the selection process

**Growth \& Revenue Expansion**

* Identify upsell and expansion opportunities within your client portfolio, including active listening about needs for additional fractional roles, extended engagements, and/or complementary services
* Leverage our to match client needs with the right expertise
* Nurture strategic account relationships that increase client lifetime value
* Collaborate with leadership to develop and execute account\-based growth strategies
* Recommend custom gifts for clients

**Communication \& Coordination Excellence**

* Coordinate between fractional executives, clients, and internal team members to align on goals, deliverables, and timelines
* Track engagement progress, deadlines, and deliverables across multiple simultaneous placements
* Respond promptly to client and fractional executive emails with thoughtful, strategic communication
* Coordinate and send calendar invites for client meetings, check\-ins, and strategic reviews
* Follow up after every meeting with clear action items, next steps, and accountability
* Prepare client reports, presentations, and strategic recommendations as needed

**Administrative \& Strategic Support**

* Utilize HubSpot, Notion, Slack, and Google Workspace to manage client data, communications, and project tracking
* Support marketing efforts by capturing client success stories and testimonials
* Conduct research on client industries and competitive landscapes to inform strategic recommendations
* Maintain confidentiality and attention to detail across all client interactions

**What You Bring**

**Essential Qualifications**

* 5\+ years of client\-facing experience, preferably with C\-level executives in B2B services environments
* Experience working with a services business (consulting, agencies, professional services, fractional work, etc.)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to run professional meetings independently
* Strong organizational and time\-management skills to manage multiple client relationships simultaneously
* Proven ability to be highly responsive to emails, coordinate meetings, and follow up with action items
* Self\-motivated to work independently \& take initiative without micromanagement
* Must have access to and regularly use a dual monitor setup to support efficient multitasking and customer success work
* Available at least 10 hours/week for remote work with reliable internet and video conferencing capabilities
* Generally available Monday\-Friday, 9am\-5pm ET for client meetings (flexible schedule otherwise)

**Nice\-to\-Have Experience**

* Consulting experience at a large firm
* Customer success or account management experience with revenue expansion responsibilities
* Sales experience with demonstrated success in B2B environments
* Proficiency in CRM systems (HubSpot preferred)
* Familiarity with Notion, Slack, and project management tools

**Personal Attributes**

* Strategic and thoughtful communicator who can translate complex ideas into clear action
* Keen attention to detail
* Comfortable with revenue\-generating activities and growth conversations
* Enthusiastic about building trust\-based relationships with clients and fractional executives
* Highly aligned with our core values of relentlessly generous, vulnerably trustworthy, enthusiastically fun, independently productive, and flexibly learning

**Work Environment:**

This is a remote position with a flexible work location. You will need a reliable internet connection and access to your own computer. While you have flexibility in your schedule, you should generally be available Monday through Friday, 9 am \- 5 pm ET, for client meetings. You’re welcome to have other clients or commitments as long as you proactively communicate your availability and can dedicate at least 10 hours per week to this role.

**How to Apply**

* Email all of the materials to our Chief of Staff at tina@malloyindustries.com and CC: hello@malloyindustries.com
* Submit your resume
* Submit a cover letter including a list of your skills, focusing on your client success experience and any sales achievements (Ensure you have set permissions to anyone can edit the document)
* Submit your hourly rate requirements
* Submit a 3\-5 minute video of yourself answering these questions and provide a link for us to watch it:
* Why are you interested in this position?
* What do you know about Malloy Industries and the fractional executive industry?
* How do you plan to balance customer success, client service, and revenue growth objectives for this role?
* What sales experience (if any) do you have, and how would you identify growth opportunities with our clients?
* Where do you see yourself in 5 years, and how can this role help you get there?

* Lead discovery conversations to uncover client pain points across creative, demand generation, sales enablement, and operational challenges

* Deliver persuasive presentations (virtual and in\-person) that communicate value and ROI clearly
* Navigate complex B2B buying processes with multiple stakeholders
* Negotiate contract terms and close deals ranging from $70K to $1,000,000 annually


**Strategic Partnerships**


* Build relationships with complementary service providers, technology platforms, and industry networks to generate referral business
* Represent JumpSeat at industry events, conferences, and networking opportunities
* Develop case studies and success stories in collaboration with account management teams to fuel future sales efforts

* Partner with Strategic Account Managers to ensure smooth client onboarding and transition from sales to delivery
* Maintain relationships with key clients post\-sale to identify expansion and upsell opportunities
* Support account teams in quarterly business reviews when strategic upsells are on the table
